alert.note: Alert for Camden; Gloucester; Mercer; Northwestern Burlington (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued January 10 at 12:59PM EST until January 10 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...In New Jersey, Mercer, Gloucester, Camden and Northwestern Burlington. In Pennsylvania, Delaware, Philadelphia and Lower Bucks. * WHEN...Until 4 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At this level, widespread roadway flooding occurs along tidal waterways. Some roads become impassable. Minor damage to vulnerable structures may begin to occur. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Delaware River at Burlington MLLW Categories - Minor 9.3 ft, Moderate 10.3 ft, Major 11.3 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.6 ft, Moderate 2.6 ft, Major 3.6 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 10/01 PM 11.1 3.4 3.4 Moderate 11/02 AM 8.4 0.7 2.2 None 11/02 PM 9.7 2.0 1.9 Minor 12/03 AM 8.2 0.5 1.9 None 12/03 PM 9.6 1.9 1.7 Minor 13/04 AM 9.9 2.2 3.6 Minor Delaware River at Philadelphia MLLW Categories - Minor 8.2 ft, Moderate 9.2 ft, Major 10.2 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.5 ft, Moderate 2.5 ft, Major 3.5 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- -------- 10/01 PM 9.4 2.7 3.2 Moderate 11/01 AM 6.9 0.2 1.9 None 11/01 PM 8.1 1.4 1.7 None 12/02 AM 6.7 0.0 1.6 None 12/02 PM 8.0 1.3 1.6 None 13/03 AM 8.5 1.8 3.3 Minor &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
